newsitem.title: POLAND: UNIVERSAL REFUSED DUTY-FREE PART IMPORTS.
newsitem.headline: UNIVERSAL REFUSED DUTY-FREE PART IMPORTS.

text.p: The Polish foreign trade ministry refused to grant a permit for duty-free car part imports to the joint venture between the Universal trader and South Korea's Hyundai Corp., Universal said on Thursday.
It said in a statement it would use all legal means to change the ministry's decision, but did not elaborate and Universal officials were not immediately available for comment.
The permit, required by a recent regulation, is necessary to import duty-free car parts for car assemby.

Earlier the industry ministry recommended to the foreign trade ministry to deny Universal the permit, saying the firm's Pultusk factory near Warsaw did not fulfil the requirements of a car assembly plant.

Universal earlier said that if it is not granted a permit it could build a fully-fledged car factory in the place of the assembling centre in Pultusk. The imports of duty-free car parts for factories are guided by different regulations.
